snippet: Authorities in Lyon, France, are promoting doggie bags, long stigmatized as a sign of poverty, in local restaurants to curb food waste.
abstract: Lyon Journal; as part of a wider drive to cut down on food waste, French authorities in the south-central region that includes Lyon have started a campaign to promote the use of doggie bags in local restaurants; effort is coming from rising consciousness of an environmentally minded younger generation that is more familiar with takeout culture, but resistance of French to concept of taking home leftovers is strong.
lead_paragraph: Authorities in Lyon, France, are promoting doggie bags, long stigmatized as a sign of poverty, in local restaurants to curb food waste.

headline.main: Brushing Off a French Stigma That Doggie Bags Are for Beggars
headline.print_headline: Brushing Off a French Stigma That Doggie Bags Are for Beggars
